Class Complex

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Number
      • sj224.tflp.math.Complex
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Complex
extends java.lang.Number
    An implementation of complex numbers
    Author:
    Johnathan Waugh

    Serialized Form

      • log

        public static Complex log(double a)
        The natural logarithm of a double, as a Complex object.
        Unlike Math.log, this gives an actual value for negative inputs.
        Parameters:
        a - The value whose natural logarithm is to be taken
        Returns:
        The natural logarithm of the specified double, as a Complex object

      • isReal

        public boolean isReal()
        Checks whether or not the current Complex object represents a real number
        Returns:
        true, if and only if imag() returns zero; false otherwise.
        See Also:
        imag()

      • theta

        public double theta()
        The angle counterclockwise from the positive x-axis to the ray starting at the origin and going through the point on the complex plane which represents this complex number
        Returns:
        Said angle, in radians, which is equal to the coefficient of the imaginary part of this complex number's natural logarithm
